name: How Sports Betting Is Changing Everything About Sports
description: Intro [0.0] Sportradar estimates the global betting market to be worth around €1.4 trillion per year. [15.807] A regulated global marketplace for sports betting is providing a new and lucrative revenue stream for the sports industry. [27.694] Data is being used to police match-fixing in the sports industry around the world. [64.564] NFL Betting [73.0] Pete Rose was banned from baseball for betting on games, highlighting the longstanding view of gambling as a threat to the integrity of American sports. [78.703] The 2018 Supreme Court decision allowing states beyond Nevada to legalize sports betting led to a surge in its popularity, with the NFL emerging as the most popular sport for betting in the US. [98.056] The influx of gambling money provides a significant revenue stream for leagues, particularly as they navigate disruptions in media rights and seek to supplement revenue at the team level. [141.724] Julius Thomas [172.0] Julius Thomas, a former NFL player, acknowledges that sports betting presents a significant temptation, particularly for young male athletes. [182.515] The NFL mandates attendance at meetings twice a year to address gambling regulations, emphasizing the prohibition of betting within NFL facilities and on NFL-related activities. [207.54] The suspension of Calvin Ridley for betting on NFL games, including those involving his own team, served as a stark reminder of the league's strict stance against gambling. [243.785] Jonte Porter [342.0] Jontay Porter received a lifetime ban from the NBA for his involvement in gambling activities. [355.355] Porter conspired with sports bettors to tip games by claiming illness and removing himself from the lineup, influencing prop bets placed on his performance. [362.82] DraftKings identified suspicious betting activity, triggering an investigation that led to Porter's ban and an ongoing criminal case against his coconspirators. [388.429] UK Sports Betting [433.0] The UK legalized sports betting in the 1960s, initially with a focus on horse racing, and has since become a global hub for the gambling industry. [438.98] The UK's central location between Asian and US markets, combined with its strong sports culture, has contributed to its prominence in the gambling world. [467.758] Soccer is the most popular sport for betting globally but faces challenges with corruption and match-fixing, as highlighted by recent cases involving players like Tonali and Paqueta. [495.995] Data analysis is crucial for detecting and preventing match-fixing in sports betting, especially with the growth of instant and mobile betting platforms. [526.359] SportRadar [548.0] Michael Jordan invested in Sportradar, a Swiss-based sports technology and data company. [552.093] Sportradar gathers data from sports leagues, packages it, and sells it to sportsbooks to create odds for betting. [579.704] Sportradar's integrity services monitor betting patterns globally to detect and flag unusual activity, potentially indicating match-fixing. [590.214] Tom Harding [654.0] Tom Harding investigates match-fixing rings run by organized crime. [658.824] Live betting markets have become a popular way to fix matches because they allow for real-time communication and payments between players and fixers. [665.956] Intelligence photographers are deployed to high-risk matches to identify and capture potential match-fixers in the crowd. [682.39] Individual sports, such as tennis, are more vulnerable to match-fixing due to lower player salaries and the global nature of the sport. [691.315] Novak Djokovic revealed he was once offered $200,000 to lose a first-round match, an offer he immediately rejected. [719.552] In 2016, BuzzFeed published the "Fixer Files," exposing potential high-level corruption in tennis. [733.065] Armenian Grigor Sargsyan, known as "The Maestro," was found to have influenced over 100 tennis players in a match-fixing scheme. [748.289] Collaboration with Belgian police led to an investigation into Sargsyan and his Belgian-Armenian crime syndicate, resulting in sanctions against numerous tennis players. [751.917] Will we see more match fixing [765.0] The possibility of a major match-fixing scandal, such as one involving the Super Bowl or World Series, is a significant concern for league commissioners. [800.382] The increasing variety of wagers, potentially including those related to offensive linemen, suggests a continued evolution and expansion of sports betting. [828.369] Protecting the integrity of the game, safeguarding players, and simultaneously leveraging sports betting for revenue and fan engagement are crucial considerations. [856.438]

markdown:
## Intro [(00:00:00)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=0s)
- Sportradar estimates the global betting market to be worth around €1.4 trillion per year. [(00:00:15)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=15s)
- A regulated global marketplace for sports betting is providing a new and lucrative revenue stream for the sports industry. [(00:00:27)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=27s)
- Data is being used to police match-fixing in the sports industry around the world. [(00:01:04)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=64s)

## NFL Betting [(00:01:13)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=73s)
- Pete Rose was banned from baseball for betting on games, highlighting the longstanding view of gambling as a threat to the integrity of American sports. [(00:01:18)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=78s)
- The 2018 Supreme Court decision allowing states beyond Nevada to legalize sports betting led to a surge in its popularity, with the NFL emerging as the most popular sport for betting in the US. [(00:01:38)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=98s)
- The influx of gambling money provides a significant revenue stream for leagues, particularly as they navigate disruptions in media rights and seek to supplement revenue at the team level. [(00:02:21)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=141s)

## Julius Thomas [(00:02:52)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=172s)
- Julius Thomas, a former NFL player, acknowledges that sports betting presents a significant temptation, particularly for young male athletes. [(00:03:02)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=182s)
- The NFL mandates attendance at meetings twice a year to address gambling regulations, emphasizing the prohibition of betting within NFL facilities and on NFL-related activities. [(00:03:27)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=207s)
- The suspension of Calvin Ridley for betting on NFL games, including those involving his own team, served as a stark reminder of the league's strict stance against gambling. [(00:04:03)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=243s)

## Jonte Porter [(00:05:42)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=342s)
- Jontay Porter received a lifetime ban from the NBA for his involvement in gambling activities. [(00:05:55)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=355s)
- Porter conspired with sports bettors to tip games by claiming illness and removing himself from the lineup, influencing prop bets placed on his performance. [(00:06:02)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=362s)
- DraftKings identified suspicious betting activity, triggering an investigation that led to Porter's ban and an ongoing criminal case against his coconspirators. [(00:06:28)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=388s)

## UK Sports Betting [(00:07:13)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=433s)
- The UK legalized sports betting in the 1960s, initially with a focus on horse racing, and has since become a global hub for the gambling industry. [(00:07:18)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=438s)
- The UK's central location between Asian and US markets, combined with its strong sports culture, has contributed to its prominence in the gambling world. [(00:07:47)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=467s)
- Soccer is the most popular sport for betting globally but faces challenges with corruption and match-fixing, as highlighted by recent cases involving players like Tonali and Paqueta. [(00:08:15)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=495s)
- Data analysis is crucial for detecting and preventing match-fixing in sports betting, especially with the growth of instant and mobile betting platforms. [(00:08:46)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=526s)

## SportRadar [(00:09:08)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=548s)
- Michael Jordan invested in Sportradar, a Swiss-based sports technology and data company. [(00:09:12)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=552s)
- Sportradar gathers data from sports leagues, packages it, and sells it to sportsbooks to create odds for betting. [(00:09:39)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=579s)
- Sportradar's integrity services monitor betting patterns globally to detect and flag unusual activity, potentially indicating match-fixing. [(00:09:50)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=590s)

## Tom Harding [(00:10:54)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=654s)
- Tom Harding investigates match-fixing rings run by organized crime. [(00:10:58)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=658s)
- Live betting markets have become a popular way to fix matches because they allow for real-time communication and payments between players and fixers. [(00:11:05)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=665s)
- Intelligence photographers are deployed to high-risk matches to identify and capture potential match-fixers in the crowd. [(00:11:22)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=682s)
- Individual sports, such as tennis, are more vulnerable to match-fixing due to lower player salaries and the global nature of the sport. [(00:11:31)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=691s)
- Novak Djokovic revealed he was once offered $200,000 to lose a first-round match, an offer he immediately rejected. [(00:11:59)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=719s)
- In 2016, BuzzFeed published the "Fixer Files," exposing potential high-level corruption in tennis. [(00:12:13)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=733s)
- Armenian Grigor Sargsyan, known as "The Maestro," was found to have influenced over 100 tennis players in a match-fixing scheme. [(00:12:28)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=748s) 
- Collaboration with Belgian police led to an investigation into Sargsyan and his Belgian-Armenian crime syndicate, resulting in sanctions against numerous tennis players. [(00:12:31)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=751s)

## Will we see more match fixing [(00:12:45)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=765s)
- The possibility of a major match-fixing scandal, such as one involving the Super Bowl or World Series, is a significant concern for league commissioners. [(00:13:20)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=800s)
- The increasing variety of wagers, potentially including those related to offensive linemen, suggests a continued evolution and expansion of sports betting. [(00:13:48)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=828s)
- Protecting the integrity of the game, safeguarding players, and simultaneously leveraging sports betting for revenue and fan engagement are crucial considerations. [(00:14:16)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LEx2_zLobrM&t=856s)
